Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Hmm, this is a detailed and complex supply chain scenario. The user wants open-ended questions that probe deeper into the process, not SQL queries. The questions should cover insights, issues, improvements, and decision implications.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I need to ensure the questions are broad enough to encourage discussion but specific enough to be relevant. They should span the entire supply chain—from R&D to after-sales—and touch on operational, strategic, and ethical aspects.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I’ll structure them to cover key areas: risk, efficiency, technology, sustainability, and adaptability. Each question should stand alone but collectively paint a holistic picture of the supply chain’s challenges and opportunities.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Avoiding technical jargon will keep them accessible while still demanding critical thinking. The goal is to make the user reflect on the interconnectedness of decisions across this global network.
